text: Karl Maramorosch (January 16, 1915 - May 9, 2016Rutgers: Celebrating 100 Years: Karl Maramorosch) was an Austrian-born American virologist, entomologist and plant pathologist. He was born in Vienna, and of Jewish descent.bti.cornell.edu He got his Ph.D. at Columbia University. He made research on viruses, mycoplasmas, rickettsiae and other micro-organisms and their transmission to plants through insect in many parts of the world. He was the co-author of a textbook on techniques in virology. He was the author of numerous papers on the biology and ecology of plant viruses, their hosts and vectors. He received the Wolf Prize in Agriculture in 1980 for his work to the study of crop pathogens. Maramorosch died in Ithaca, New York on May 9, 2016, aged 101. ==References== Category:1915 births Category:2016 deaths Category:American botanists Category:American centenarians Category:Austrian Jews Category:Columbia University alumni Category:Jewish American academics Category:Jewish American scientists Category:Jewish centenarians Category:Jewish Wolf Prize winners Category:Naturalized citizens of the United States Category:Polish Jews Category:Refugees from Nazism Category:Scientists from Vienna Category:American virologists Category:Educators from New York City Category:American entomologists Category:Pathologists
